meanings.definition: To surpass in organization or efficiency.
meanings.sent1: She outorganizes her classmates by keeping her study materials neatly arranged.
meanings.sent2: The new software outorganizes the old system by streamlining processes.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outorganizes the birds by storing nuts in different places.
meanings.sent4: His strategic mind outorganizes the competition, making him a successful leader.
meanings.sent5: The ant outorganizes other insects by working together efficiently.

meanings.definition: To arrange or plan more effectively than others.
meanings.sent1: He outorganizes his friends by always having a detailed itinerary for trips.
meanings.sent2: The event planner outorganizes her colleagues by coordinating every detail flawlessly.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle master outorganizes everyone by solving complex puzzles in record time.
meanings.sent4: Her color-coded calendar outorganizes others, ensuring she never misses an appointment.
meanings.sent5: The coach outorganizes the opponents with clever game strategies.
